intro: Niebuhria woodii, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces a bulbous underground stem, which helps it survive in harsh, dry conditions. Its botanical features make it well adapted to extreme environments, with deep root systems and the ability to store water efficiently. Niebuhria woodii is often found in rocky soils and is a symbol of resilience in desert ecosystems.
